result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Madisyn M. Brakke in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Madisyn M. Brakke. Called @ 2:16 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for arraignment. Record by Atty. Selmek who enters not guilty pleas and reserves speedy trial. Victims are present in Court, but do not wish to make a statement. Further record by Atty. Selmek as to new address for defendant :  325 W. Main Street, Port Washington, WI  53074. Atty. asks for 60 days for status. Court sets as requested.
Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: with Exhibit #1 attached.

2:01 PM (64-06) Defendant Madisyn M. Brakke appeared in court, Attorney Renner in court for Leah Selmek for Madisyn M. Brakke appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
State called to the stand as a witness Patrol Officer from the Town of Delavan Ben McMasters.
Ben McMasters duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination of ADA Herrmann. Witness identified defendant in court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:03 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Renner.
Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Herrmann.
2:08 PM - Argument by Attorney Renner.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds her over to stand trial on the charges. 
State is requesting an arraignment date. No objection by Attorney Renner.

Adj. 2:12 PM

Court's response to request to appearance via phone "Pursuant to Wis. Stat. s. 967.08(2)(b), the Court has no authority to permit a phone/video appearance for a party in a preliminary hearing, unless there will be a waiver under s. 970.03. At the present time, there is nothing in the record to indicate there will be a waiver. Accordingly, the Court is bound to deny the request at this time." PNavis

Defendant Madisyn M. Brakke appeared, Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant does not qualify for SPD attorney.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed. Petition for Appointmnet of an Attorney

Defendant Madisyn M Brakke appeared in court. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses State as to charging decision. State asks court for 2 weeks to file complaint. Court addresses Attorney rights and provides information. Response by defendant that they won't appoint because there is no complaint filed. Recalled, Court goes over MFAC paperwork with defendant. Court swears defendant as to motion paperwork(affidavit). Defendnat is going to see if SPD will reevaluate her first. If she qualifies SPD to appoint. If she does not qualify for SPD, court will appoint attorney and order should be sent up for Judge Reddy's signature. Minutes filed.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Defendant Madisyn M Brakke in court.  Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant given MFAC paperwork.  Minutes filed.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2,000.00 CASH  
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.    Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH DAM ROAD GUN SHOP.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTORS RICKEY MAJORS OR JOZLYNN WILLIS.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
